title: Ticket #2354: Statistics in DaemonCore
description:
Implement the following statistics in Daemon Core

The following will always be published. 

DaemonCoreDutyCycle      double   ratio of time spent in select verses elapsed time over the lifetime of the daemon
RecentDaemonCoreDutyCycle      double   ratio of time spent in select verses elapsed time over the recent time window

The following will be enabled when the Daemon Core publishing level declared in STATISTICS_TO_PUBLISH is >= 1 

DCStatsLifetime           RelTime   total time the daemon has been collecting statistics. (uptime)
DCRecentStatsLifetime     RelTime   time represented by statics values who's names begin with RecentDC (recent window)
DCSelectWaittime          RelTime   total time spent waiting in select
DCSignalRuntime           RelTime   total time spent handling signals
DCTimerRuntime            RelTime   total time spent handling timers
DCSocketRuntime           RelTime   total time spent handling socket messages
DCPipeRuntime             RelTime   total time spent handling pipe messages
DCSignals                 int       number of signals handlers called
DCTimersFired             int       number of timer handlers called
DCSockMessages            int       number of socket handlers called
DCPipeMessages            int       number of pipe handlers called

The following will be enabled when the Daemon Core publishing level declared in STATISTICS_TO_PUBLISH is >= 2 

DCStatsLastUpdateTime     AbsTime   time of last update of DCxxxx statistics values
DCRecentStatsTickTime     AbsTime   time of last update of RecentDCxxxx statistics values
DCRecentWindowMax         RelTime   maximum size of Recent Window
DCDebugOuts               int       number of dprintf calls that were written to output.
DCPumpCycleCount          int       numer of times the Daemon core main loop has cycled.
DCPumpCycleSum            double    Total number of seconds spent in the daemon core main loop.
DCPumpCycleMin            double    Minimum number of seconds of a single cycle of the daemon core pump
DCPumpCycleMin            double    Maximum number of seconds of a single cycle of the daemon core pump
DCPumpCycleAvg            double    Average number of seconds of a single cycle of the daemon core pump

each registering Daemon Core handler will have 2 statistics values with an overall and Recent for each. 

DC{Type}_{handler}        int       number of times the handler has been called
DC{Type}_{handler}Runtime double    seconds that the handler spent running

{Type} can be "Signal" "Socket" "Pipe" or "Timer" (Timer not yet implemented). {handler} is the handler_descrip string passed at registration.

Each counter will have a corresponding Recent timer that shows the counts from the latest DCRecentStatsLifetime seconds.

For instance the master typically has the following two dynamic statistics 

DCSignal_handle_dc_sigquit = 0
DCSignal_handle_dc_sigquitRuntime = 0.0
RecentDCSignal_handle_dc_sigquit = 0
RecentDCSignal_handle_dc_sigquitRuntime = 0.0
DCSocket_DCCommandHandler = 216
DCSocket_DCCommandHandlerRuntime = 0.155999
RecentDCSocket_DCCommandHandler = 0
RecentDCSocket_DCCommandHandlerRuntime = 0.0
and several others.

the following are desired, but too much work to implement at this time 

DCSockBytes               int       number of bytes passed though the socket
DCPipeBytes               int       number of bytes passed though the socket
